RUN.name: RUN
RUN.description: When this bit is set by software, the LCDIF will begin transferring data between the SoC and the display

enumeratedValues.name: ALL_24_BITS_VALID
enumeratedValues.description: Data input to the block is in 24 bpp format, such that all RGB 888 data is contained in 24 bits.

enumeratedValues.name: DROP_UPPER_2_BITS_PER_BYTE
enumeratedValues.description: Data input to the block is actually RGB 18 bpp, but there is 1 color per byte, hence the upper 2 bits in each byte do not contain any useful data, and should be dropped.

enumeratedValues.name: LOWER_18_BITS_VALID
enumeratedValues.description: Data input to the block is in 18 bpp format, such that lower 18 bits contain RGB 666 and upper 14 bits do not contain any useful data.

enumeratedValues.name: UPPER_18_BITS_VALID
enumeratedValues.description: Data input to the block is in 18 bpp format, such that upper 18 bits contain RGB 666 and lower 14 bits do not contain any useful data.

DATA_FORMAT_16_BIT.name: DATA_FORMAT_16_BIT
DATA_FORMAT_16_BIT.description: When this bit is 1 and WORD_LENGTH = 0, it implies that the 16-bit data is in ARGB555 format

MASTER.name: MASTER
MASTER.description: Set this bit to make the LCDIF act as a bus master

ENABLE_PXP_HANDSHAKE.name: ENABLE_PXP_HANDSHAKE
ENABLE_PXP_HANDSHAKE.description: If this bit is set and LCDIF_MASTER bit is set, the LCDIF will act as bus master and the handshake mechanism between LCDIF and PXP will be turned on

enumeratedValues.name: 16_BIT
enumeratedValues.description: Input data is 16 bits per pixel.

enumeratedValues.name: 18_BIT
enumeratedValues.description: Input data is 18 bits per pixel.

enumeratedValues.name: 24_BIT
enumeratedValues.description: Input data is 24 bits per pixel.

LCD_DATABUS_WIDTH.name: LCD_DATABUS_WIDTH
LCD_DATABUS_WIDTH.description: LCD Data bus transfer width. When LUT enabled, this field should be set to 0x01.

CSC_DATA_SWIZZLE.name: CSC_DATA_SWIZZLE
CSC_DATA_SWIZZLE.description: This field specifies how to swap the bytes after the data has been converted into an internal representation of 24 bits per pixel and before it is transmitted over the LCD interface bus

INPUT_DATA_SWIZZLE.name: INPUT_DATA_SWIZZLE
INPUT_DATA_SWIZZLE.description: This field specifies how to swap the bytes fetched by the bus master interface

DOTCLK_MODE.name: DOTCLK_MODE
DOTCLK_MODE.description: Set this bit to 1 to make the hardware go into the DOTCLK mode, i

BYPASS_COUNT.name: BYPASS_COUNT
BYPASS_COUNT.description: When this bit is 0, it means that LCDIF will stop the block operation and turn off the RUN bit after the amount of data indicated by the LCDIF_TRANSFER_COUNT register has been transferred out

SHIFT_NUM_BITS.name: SHIFT_NUM_BITS
SHIFT_NUM_BITS.description: The data to be transmitted is shifted left or right by this number of bits.

DATA_SHIFT_DIR.name: DATA_SHIFT_DIR
DATA_SHIFT_DIR.description: Use this bit to determine the direction of shift of transmit data.

enumeratedValues.name: TXDATA_SHIFT_LEFT
enumeratedValues.description: Data to be transmitted is shifted LEFT by SHIFT_NUM_BITS bits.

enumeratedValues.name: TXDATA_SHIFT_RIGHT
enumeratedValues.description: Data to be transmitted is shifted RIGHT by SHIFT_NUM_BITS bits.

CLKGATE.name: CLKGATE
CLKGATE.description: This bit must be set to zero for normal operation

SFTRST.name: SFTRST
SFTRST.description: This bit must be set to zero to enable normal operation of the LCDIF

RUN.name: RUN
RUN.description: When this bit is set by software, the LCDIF will begin transferring data between the SoC and the display

enumeratedValues.description: Data input to the block is in 24 bpp format, such that all RGB 888 data is contained in 24 bits.

CLKGATE.name: CLKGATE
CLKGATE.description: This bit must be set to zero for normal operation

SFTRST.name: SFTRST
SFTRST.description: This bit must be set to zero to enable normal operation of the LCDIF

VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ.name: VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ
VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ.description: This bit is set to indicate that an interrupt is requested by the LCDIF block

CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ.name: CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ
CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ.description: This bit is set to indicate that an interrupt is requested by the LCDIF block

UNDERFLOW_IRQ.name: UNDERFLOW_IRQ
UNDERFLOW_IRQ.description: This bit is set to indicate that an interrupt is requested by the LCDIF block

OVERFLOW_IRQ.name: OVERFLOW_IRQ
OVERFLOW_IRQ.description: This bit is set to indicate that an interrupt is requested by the LCDIF block

VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ_EN.name: VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ_EN
VSYNC_EDGE_IRQ_EN.description: This bit is set to enable an interrupt every time the hardware encounters the leading VSYNC edge in the VSYNC and DOTCLK modes, or the beginning of every field in DVI mode

CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ_EN.name: CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ_EN
CUR_FRAME_DONE_IRQ_EN.description: This bit is set to 1 enable an interrupt every time the hardware enters in the vertical blanking state

UNDERFLOW_IRQ_EN.name: UNDERFLOW_IRQ_EN
UNDERFLOW_IRQ_EN.description: This bit is set to enable an underflow interrupt in the TXFIFO in the write mode.

OVERFLOW_IRQ_EN.name: OVERFLOW_IRQ_EN
OVERFLOW_IRQ_EN.description: This bit is set to enable an overflow interrupt in the TXFIFO in the write mode.

BYTE_PACKING_FORMAT.name: BYTE_PACKING_FORMAT
BYTE_PACKING_FORMAT.description: This bitfield is used to show which data bytes in a 32-bit word are valid

IRQ_ON_ALTERNATE_FIELDS.name: IRQ_ON_ALTERNATE_FIELDS
IRQ_ON_ALTERNATE_FIELDS.description: If this bit is set, the LCDIF block will assert the cur_frame_done interrupt only on alternate fields, otherwise it will issue the interrupt on both odd and even field

FIFO_CLEAR.name: FIFO_CLEAR
FIFO_CLEAR.description: Set this bit to clear all the data in the latency FIFO (LFIFO), TXFIFO and the RXFIFO.

START_INTERLACE_FROM_SECOND_FIELD.name: START_INTERLACE_FROM_SECOND_FIELD
START_INTERLACE_FROM_SECOND_FIELD.description: The default is to grab the odd lines first and then the even lines

INTERLACE_FIELDS.name: INTERLACE_FIELDS
INTERLACE_FIELDS.description: Set this bit if it is required that the LCDIF block fetches odd lines in one field and even lines in the other field

RECOVER_ON_UNDERFLOW.name: RECOVER_ON_UNDERFLOW
RECOVER_ON_UNDERFLOW.description: Set this bit to enable the LCDIF block to recover in the next field/frame if there was an underflow in the current field/frame

BM_ERROR_IRQ.name: BM_ERROR_IRQ
BM_ERROR_IRQ.description: This bit is set to indicate that an interrupt is requested by the LCDIF block

BM_ERROR_IRQ_EN.name: BM_ERROR_IRQ_EN
BM_ERROR_IRQ_EN.description: This bit is set to enable bus master error interrupt in the LCDIF master mode.

CS_OUT_SELECT.name: CS_OUT_SELECT
CS_OUT_SELECT.description: This bit is CS0/CS1 valid select signals

IMAGE_DATA_SELECT.name: IMAGE_DATA_SELECT
IMAGE_DATA_SELECT.description: Command Mode MIPI image data select bit

EVEN_LINE_PATTERN.name: EVEN_LINE_PATTERN
EVEN_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in EVEN lines (line numbers 2,4,6,

ODD_LINE_PATTERN.name: ODD_LINE_PATTERN
ODD_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in ODD lines (line numbers 1,3,5,

BURST_LEN_8.name: BURST_LEN_8
BURST_LEN_8.description: By default, when the LCDIF is in the bus master mode, it will issue AXI bursts of length 16 (except when in packed 24 bpp mode, it will issue bursts of length 15)

OUTSTANDING_REQS.name: OUTSTANDING_REQS
OUTSTANDING_REQS.description: This bitfield indicates the maximum number of outstanding transactions that LCDIF should request when it is acting as a bus master

EVEN_LINE_PATTERN.name: EVEN_LINE_PATTERN
EVEN_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in EVEN lines (line numbers 2,4,6,

ODD_LINE_PATTERN.name: ODD_LINE_PATTERN
ODD_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in ODD lines (line numbers 1,3,5,

BURST_LEN_8.name: BURST_LEN_8
BURST_LEN_8.description: By default, when the LCDIF is in the bus master mode, it will issue AXI bursts of length 16 (except when in packed 24 bpp mode, it will issue bursts of length 15)

OUTSTANDING_REQS.name: OUTSTANDING_REQS
OUTSTANDING_REQS.description: This bitfield indicates the maximum number of outstanding transactions that LCDIF should request when it is acting as a bus master

EVEN_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in EVEN lines (line numbers 2,4,6,

ODD_LINE_PATTERN.name: ODD_LINE_PATTERN
ODD_LINE_PATTERN.description: This field determines the order of the RGB components of each pixel in ODD lines (line numbers 1,3,5,

BURST_LEN_8.description: By default, when the LCDIF is in the bus master mode, it will issue AXI bursts of length 16 (except when in packed 24 bpp mode, it will issue bursts of length 15)

OUTSTANDING_REQS.description: This bitfield indicates the maximum number of outstanding transactions that LCDIF should request when it is acting as a bus master

OUTSTANDING_REQS.name: OUTSTANDING_REQS
OUTSTANDING_REQS.description: This bitfield indicates the maximum number of outstanding transactions that LCDIF should request when it is acting as a bus master

TRANSFER_COUNT.name: TRANSFER_COUNT
TRANSFER_COUNT.description: LCDIF Horizontal and Vertical Valid Data Count Register

H_COUNT.name: H_COUNT
H_COUNT.description: Total valid data (pixels) in each horizontal line

V_COUNT.name: V_COUNT
V_COUNT.description: Number of horizontal lines per frame which contain valid data

CUR_BUF.name: CUR_BUF
CUR_BUF.description: LCD Interface Current Buffer Address Register

ADDR.name: ADDR
ADDR.description: Address of the current frame being transmitted by LCDIF.

NEXT_BUF.name: NEXT_BUF
NEXT_BUF.description: LCD Interface Next Buffer Address Register

ADDR.name: ADDR
ADDR.description: Address of the next frame that will be transmitted by LCDIF.

VDCTRL0.name: VDCTRL0
VDCTRL0.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register0

VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.name: VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH
VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.description: Number of units for which VSYNC signal is active

HALF_LINE_MODE.name: HALF_LINE_MODE
HALF_LINE_MODE.description: When this bit is 0, the first field (VSYNC period) will end in half a horizontal line and the second field will begin with half a horizontal line

HALF_LINE.name: HALF_LINE
HALF_LINE.description: Setting this bit to 1 will make the total VSYNC period equal to the VSYNC_PERIOD field plus half the HORIZONTAL_PERIOD field (i

VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH_UNIT.name: VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH_UNIT
VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH_UNIT.description: Default 0 for counting VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH in terms of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles

VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT.name: VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT
VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT.description: Default 0 for counting VSYNC_PERIOD in terms of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles

ENABLE_POL.name: ENABLE_POL
ENABLE_POL.description: Default 0 active low during valid data transfer on each horizontal line.

DOTCLK_POL.name: DOTCLK_POL
DOTCLK_POL.description: Default is data launched at negative edge of DOTCLK and captured at positive edge

HSYNC_POL.name: HSYNC_POL
HSYNC_POL.description: Default 0 active low during HSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH time and will be high during the rest of the HSYNC period

VSYNC_POL.name: VSYNC_POL
VSYNC_POL.description: Default 0 active low during VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH time and will be high during the rest of the VSYNC period

ENABLE_PRESENT.name: ENABLE_PRESENT
ENABLE_PRESENT.description: Setting this bit to 1 will make the hardware generate the ENABLE signal in the DOTCLK mode, thereby making it the true RGB interface along with the remaining three signals VSYNC, HSYNC and DOTCLK

VDCTRL0_SET.name: VDCTRL0_SET
VDCTRL0_SET.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register0

VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.name: VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH
VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.description: Number of units for which VSYNC signal is active

HALF_LINE_MODE.description: When this bit is 0, the first field (VSYNC period) will end in half a horizontal line and the second field will begin with half a horizontal line

VDCTRL0_TOG.name: VDCTRL0_TOG
VDCTRL0_TOG.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register0

VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.name: VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH
VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.description: Number of units for which VSYNC signal is active

HALF_LINE_MODE.description: When this bit is 0, the first field (VSYNC period) will end in half a horizontal line and the second field will begin with half a horizontal line

VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH_UNIT.description: Default 0 for counting VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH in terms of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles

VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT.name: VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT
VSYNC_PERIOD_UNIT.description: Default 0 for counting VSYNC_PERIOD in terms of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles

ENABLE_POL.name: ENABLE_POL
ENABLE_POL.description: Default 0 active low during valid data transfer on each horizontal line.

DOTCLK_POL.name: DOTCLK_POL
DOTCLK_POL.description: Default is data launched at negative edge of DOTCLK and captured at positive edge

HSYNC_POL.name: HSYNC_POL
HSYNC_POL.description: Default 0 active low during HSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH time and will be high during the rest of the HSYNC period

VSYNC_POL.name: VSYNC_POL
VSYNC_POL.description: Default 0 active low during VSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH time and will be high during the rest of the VSYNC period

ENABLE_PRESENT.name: ENABLE_PRESENT
ENABLE_PRESENT.description: Setting this bit to 1 will make the hardware generate the ENABLE signal in the DOTCLK mode, thereby making it the true RGB interface along with the remaining three signals VSYNC, HSYNC and DOTCLK

VDCTRL1.name: VDCTRL1
VDCTRL1.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register1

VSYNC_PERIOD.name: VSYNC_PERIOD
VSYNC_PERIOD.description: Total number of units between two positive or two negative edges of the VSYNC signal

VDCTRL2.name: VDCTRL2
VDCTRL2.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register2

HSYNC_PERIOD.name: HSYNC_PERIOD
HSYNC_PERIOD.description: Total number of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles between two positive or two negative edges of the HSYNC signal

HSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.name: HSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH
HSYNC_PULSE_WIDTH.description: Number of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles for which HSYNC signal is active.

VDCTRL3.name: VDCTRL3
VDCTRL3.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register3

VERTICAL_WAIT_CNT.name: VERTICAL_WAIT_CNT
VERTICAL_WAIT_CNT.description: In the VSYNC interface mode, wait for this number of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles from the falling VSYNC edge (or rising if VSYNC_POL is 1) before starting LCD transactions and is applicable only if WAIT_FOR_VSYNC_EDGE is set

HORIZONTAL_WAIT_CNT.name: HORIZONTAL_WAIT_CNT
HORIZONTAL_WAIT_CNT.description: In the DOTCLK mode, wait for this number of clocks from falling edge (or rising if HSYNC_POL is 1) of HSYNC signal to account for horizontal back porch plus the number of DOTCLKs before the moving picture information begins

VSYNC_ONLY.name: VSYNC_ONLY
VSYNC_ONLY.description: This bit must be set to 1 in the VSYNC mode of operation, and 0 in the DOTCLK mode of operation.

MUX_SYNC_SIGNALS.name: MUX_SYNC_SIGNALS
MUX_SYNC_SIGNALS.description: When this bit is set, the LCDIF block will internally mux HSYNC with LCD_D14, DOTCLK with LCD_D13 and ENABLE with LCD_D12, otherwise these signals will go out on separate pins

VDCTRL4.name: VDCTRL4
VDCTRL4.description: LCDIF VSYNC Mode and Dotclk Mode Control Register4

DOTCLK_H_VALID_DATA_CNT.name: DOTCLK_H_VALID_DATA_CNT
DOTCLK_H_VALID_DATA_CNT.description: Total number of DISPLAY CLOCK (pix_clk) cycles on each horizontal line that carry valid data in DOTCLK mode

SYNC_SIGNALS_ON.name: SYNC_SIGNALS_ON
SYNC_SIGNALS_ON.description: Set this field to 1 if the LCD controller requires that the VSYNC or VSYNC/HSYNC/DOTCLK control signals should be active at least one frame before the data transfers actually start and remain active at least one frame after the data transfers end

DOTCLK_DLY_SEL.name: DOTCLK_DLY_SEL
DOTCLK_DLY_SEL.description: This bitfield selects the amount of time by which the DOTCLK signal should be delayed before coming out of the LCD_DOTCK pin

ADDR.name: ADDR
ADDR.description: Virtual address at which bus master error occurred.

LFIFO_COUNT.name: LFIFO_COUNT
LFIFO_COUNT.description: Read only view of the current count in Latency buffer (LFIFO).

TXFIFO_EMPTY.name: TXFIFO_EMPTY
TXFIFO_EMPTY.description: Read only view of the signals that indicates LCD TXFIFO is empty.

TXFIFO_FULL.name: TXFIFO_FULL
TXFIFO_FULL.description: Read only view of the signals that indicates LCD TXFIFO is full.

LFIFO_EMPTY.name: LFIFO_EMPTY
LFIFO_EMPTY.description: Read only view of the signals that indicates LCD LFIFO is empty.

LFIFO_FULL.name: LFIFO_FULL
LFIFO_FULL.description: Read only view of the signals that indicates LCD LFIFO is full.

DMA_REQ.name: DMA_REQ
DMA_REQ.description: Reflects the current state of the DMA Request line for the LCDIF

PRESENT.name: PRESENT
PRESENT.description: 0: LCDIF not present on this product 1: LCDIF is present.

FD_PERIOD.name: FD_PERIOD
FD_PERIOD.description: Period of line counter during FD phase

LD_PERIOD.name: LD_PERIOD
LD_PERIOD.description: Period of pclk counter during LD phase

FD_PERIOD.name: FD_PERIOD
FD_PERIOD.description: Period of line counter during FD phase

LD_PERIOD.name: LD_PERIOD
LD_PERIOD.description: Period of pclk counter during LD phase

FD_PERIOD.description: Period of line counter during FD phase

LD_PERIOD.name: LD_PERIOD
LD_PERIOD.description: Period of pclk counter during LD phase

FD_PERIOD.name: FD_PERIOD
FD_PERIOD.description: Period of line counter during FD phase

LD_PERIOD.name: LD_PERIOD
LD_PERIOD.description: Period of pclk counter during LD phase

PIGEON_CLK_GATE.name: PIGEON_CLK_GATE
PIGEON_CLK_GATE.description: Pigeon mode dot clock gate enable

PIGEON_CLK_GATE.name: PIGEON_CLK_GATE
PIGEON_CLK_GATE.description: Pigeon mode dot clock gate enable

PIGEON_CLK_GATE.name: PIGEON_CLK_GATE
PIGEON_CLK_GATE.description: Pigeon mode dot clock gate enable

PIGEON_CLK_GATE.name: PIGEON_CLK_GATE
PIGEON_CLK_GATE.description: Pigeon mode dot clock gate enable

EN.name: EN
EN.description: Enable pigeon Mode on this signal

enumeratedValues.name: SIG_ANOTHER
enumeratedValues.description: Use another signal as tick event

MASK_CNT_SEL.name: MASK_CNT_SEL
MASK_CNT_SEL.description: select global counters as mask condition, use together with MASK_CNT

enumeratedValues.name: HSTATE_CNT
enumeratedValues.description: pclk counter within one hscan state

enumeratedValues.name: HSTATE_CYCLE
enumeratedValues.description: pclk cycle within one hscan state

enumeratedValues.name: VSTATE_CNT
enumeratedValues.description: line counter within one vscan state

enumeratedValues.name: VSTATE_CYCLE
enumeratedValues.description: line cycle within one vscan state

enumeratedValues.name: HCNT
enumeratedValues.description: horizontal counter (pclk counter within one line )

enumeratedValues.name: VCNT
enumeratedValues.description: vertical counter (line counter within one frame)

MASK_CNT.name: MASK_CNT
MASK_CNT.description: When the global counter selected through MASK_CNT_SEL matches value in this reg, pigeon local counter start ticking

STATE_MASK.name: STATE_MASK
STATE_MASK.description: state_mask = (FS|FB|FD|FE) and (LS|LB|LD|LE) , select any combination of scan states as reference point for local counter to start ticking

SET_CNT.name: SET_CNT
SET_CNT.description: Assert signal output when counter match this value

CLR_CNT.name: CLR_CNT
CLR_CNT.description: Deassert signal output when counter match this value
